intro: Polgidon, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a perennial plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its dark green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, spadix-like flowers. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Polgidon contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
